documents.document:
2012 Power Rankings

Here is a preseason version of my 2012 power rankings. They are based off my own research. I'm sure people will disagree on some spots as I am really high on some teams and low on others. Let me know where you think I'm off and why.For more information on this topic see boss underwear .

1. New England
2. Green Bay
3. Pittsburgh
4. Baltimore
5. Houston
6. Philadelphia
7. Chicago
8. NY Giants
9. Atlanta
10. New Orleans
11. Kansas City
12. Buffalo
13. NY Jets
14. Dallas
15. San Francisco

WpgCapper Re:

I really like your list. Like that you've mixed it up vs the consensus picks. ex/ i like that you don't have SF as a top 5 team which I agree with. I think they fall off a bit this year mainly bc i think the NFC west teams have improved a lot they won't have the same cupcake games they had last year so i like where you ranked them.

What's your reasoning for having Pittsburgh so high? I feel they're due to fall behind baltimore and cinch this year.

Other teams I thought were odd.

Arizona - too low, they finish close to or at .500 this year

Minnesota - you have them just one back of tampa, seems disrespectful to tampa i think they have a good year. Minnesota is a bottom 4 team for sure.

St. Louis - too low, they finished last year with seemingly their entire team on IR. Theres a reason they were predicted to win the division last year. Fischer finds ways to win without star studded rosters. For additional information see sexy costumes to make .

slacker00 Re:

I agree with wpgcapper that the Rams and Cards are closer to 8-8 calibre than #29 and #31.

Otherwise, Detroit at #19 seems like an obvious mistake, they are easily in the top 10 ahead of Atlanta, NO, IMHO.

Another head scratcher is Buffalo at , I don't get that at all. They are just inside the bottom 10, best I can tell.

Why would the Pats give Wes Welker an extension

There's numerous examples of very young WRs being very productive for cheap

Welker isn't a QB... he's a 31 year old WR who will not get any better.

jjgold Re:

With Tom Brady and young talented receiver will be just like Welker

Welker could not even make Jets roster because of poor QB .

rake922 Re:

Yea so he should just realize: "I guess it simply wouldn't make sense for them to be so dumb and offer me a huge cash valued extension"

SparJMU Re:

You honestly don't think Welker is a key part of that offense? His production is ridiculous. What about the year he got hurt, and there was no one on the roster who could fill his shoes? Welker is lightning quick laterally, and he can navigate the slot better than anyone else in the league.

seaborneq Re:

Welles is 31 and not a qb. He should beg the pats to give him one year deal the rest of his career. No way does he produce those numbers with any other team.

Who do you like - NFL Futures

Thinking of taking a few futures to ride this season. Would love to hear some thoughts.

Stallion Re:

49ers over 10 same team as last year, with upgrades at WR.

NewYorkKnicks87 Re:

I like Packers and Raven to make Super Bowl .

grizzliewww. Re:

As you can see I'm pretty high on the bears, I think with Martz gone and the additions of a truely elite reciever in BM the bears can go 12-4 with their schedule. Injuries could **** me but It's a risk I'm willing to take.

Also got $30 on the Bills to win the SB at +8600. Purely a hedge bet, I think they'll finally get over the hump and make the playoffs allowing me some guaranteed profit.

Would like to hear other peoples thoughts and ideas. I'm also looking at the Jets u8.5 wins, I love the Jets but think they will struggle this year especially on the defense end without Leonhard bossing things from the back.

SparJMU Re:

Are all five starters on the 49ers offensive line returning? The reason why the 49ers won last year was their ability to control the line offensively and defensively. If they have the same personnel again this year I would expect the same results.

Shannon Brown Related to Chris Brown?

they look just alike and they even have the same last name.... what a coincidence.
Chris brown can also play good basketball just like shannon brown and shannon brown is a pretty good singer also... like chris brown.
but they deny that they're related. For more information on this topic see halloween apparel .

All3nIv3rson Re:

I don't think they are related, maybe. The name of Shannon's father is Chris. I don't know why he gave his son an Irish white girl name.To me this picture proves more than anything that Shannon Brown is not the so-called 6foot4 the NBA claims he is. Chris Brown is 6'1 and they look the same height. Even Kobe said Shannon is barely 6'1. smh at the NBA lying about the height of its players all the time.

bobie4 Re:

so true... how can KG be 6'11 when its clear that he's as tall as Pau Gasol! For additional information see boss underwear .

Bounce Re:

KG is actually 7' but he refused to be listed at 7' because he felt that 7' is a typical Center height so he feared that he might be playing C by coachs decision. This happened way back in Minn, and so they still put him at 6'11... and anyways like there's a big difference in 6'11 & 7

NBA 2K12 Suggestions

Post NBA 2K12 suggestions here. 2K11 is a great game, but leaves more to be desired. Let's post here so 2K will get the next one right.

JBrown1182 Re:

BallaBoy21 brings up some great points. He's obviously a long-time 2k franchise player like myself. We're the gamers and NBA fans 2k needs real feedback from.

canyoulockthis: Kobe, Ray Allen and Evan Turner do look like aliens in this game! That's the first thing I noticed when looking at these players. Also, did anyone else notice John Wall has long sideburns/ facial hair on one side of his face and not the other? ... Weird.

As far as technicals go, I recall 2k saying something like they can't add technicals because it would entail mild violence, and therefore the game wouldn't get an "E" rating or something. Whatever. Ts would still be a good addition for the sake of realism.

coolcras712 Re:

Technical fouls are not in the game because the NBA wont allow it not 2k, 2k would receive a fine and could face losing their ability to make a basketball game all together if they decided to not follow the NBA strict guide lines we all know EA would jump at the chance to buy exclusive right so 2k has to walk a fine line, anything considered negative is not all in the game that goes for Tattoos that are considered offensive as well.

Online Quick Game Search Workaround?

the only reason why I play this game is because I like the competitiveness/online aspect, but yet I have a high speed connection and it takes 20-30 minutes just to find a game ???

gimme a break ! just because I use WI-FI I get a gimped connection ? I'm tired of waiting almost an hour for games, im getting the new COD map pack and trading this game in.

Daveakamaddngod Re:

I never even heard about this workaround. Just did this and it actually worked. I need to make sure this works for others before declaring it a workaround, even though I may just be out of the loop on this one. Trying to play this game at 1am waiting to get a single game it is sleep inducing. Who needs synthetic sleep aids? Just try finding a quick game and you'll be in bed in no time.

Regardless of my attempt at humor, please report if this works for each.

ratedmoney Re:

This workaround has been on the forums for a couple weeks, its how people have been getting into crew games, it is legit. However there was 1 person who said they got banned from live because of it, but thats only 1 person claiming that

NFL

Do you have one of those questions that you just can't seem to find the answer to ?? This is the thread to ask it. Do you have a nagging question about the NFL or football in general like "could someone tell me what they mean in the NFL by the 2 minute drill". For more information on this topic see adidas underwear .

bears9 Re:

the 2 minuete drill a drill coaches use in practice to simulate the last 2 minuetes of a game showing what plays they wil use or when they call time outs or spike it

does that answer your question

Bette Re:

OH cool, a thread made for Bette. I have asked a lot of questions already but dont have one right now. I am sure I will though.
I could use more information about John Beck for my grandson. I understand from my sister that BYU has put some good quarterbacks out there. What has this kid done? For additional information see christmas panties .

Lefty Noob Re:

"Finished his career at BYU as the Cougars' second all-time leading passer with 11,021 yards ... also finished second behind Ty Detmer in total offense with 11,059 yards ... totaled 17 different 300-yard games, ranking tied for second with Jim McMahon and John Walsh for most career 300-yard games ... played in 43 games during his career, ranking second behind Detmer (46 games) ... totaled 79 career touchdown completions, ranking third behind Detmer (121) and McMahon (84) ... totaled a career efficiency rating of 141.29--the ninth highest career efficiency rating in BYU history ... the Mountain West Conference career record holder in total offense (11,059), passing attempts (1,418 ), completions (885), passing yards (11,021), touchdown completions (79) ... ranks second on the MWC career list with a completion percentage of 62.4."

Playoffs

It’s Couch-potato season again.

A real barnburner between the Saints and 49ers today, maybe the best game of the year?.
Can’t say the same for the Pats vs. Broncos who put on a real stinker

My Saints played like crap today. They didn't deserve to win. As much as I hate to say it, the best playing team did win that game. OMG that hurt to say.

The Broncos and Patriots game was like a train wreck. I didn't want to watch it anymore but I just couldn't quit watching. I strongly dislike the Pats, but they were on it tonight.

The voices in my head are mad at me. They're giving me the silent treatment now.

WestCoast Re:

He could only watch as Alex Smith and the San Francisco 49ers stole it away in the closing seconds, ending the Saints’ chances at another Super Bowl run.
Brees capped his record-setting season by throwing for 462 yards and four touchdowns, throwing two go-ahead strikes in the final 5 minutes only to see the 49ers rally for a 36-32 playoff victory Saturday."

LSC9901 Re:

wanna guess that record setting game again ? Actually I find your guess to be pretty much on target but WOW did they ever play a game last night. I haven't seen their offense or defense play as well all year as they did last night. A real blow out but now maybe some folks will take Mr. Tebow off his pedestal. He is good but we kicked butt !

Worst Baseball Call Ever?

We've been talking over in the football forum - Worst call ever? - about the worst officiating calls of all time. It got me to wondering, what do you think are the worst calls ever by baseball umpires? Definitely a couple of them, in my book, have to belong to Bob Davidson in the WBC and another by Bob Davidson in the 2010 Marlins game against the Phillies. I'm sure the Jeffery Maher incident will come up too.

legend Re:

The obvious one is the Don Denkinger call of Jorge Orta being safe at first in the 1985 World Series Game Six. Cost the Cards the Series.

ThePundit Re:

How about the ump in the '78 series NOT calling interference on Reggie Jackson when he stuck his butt out to stop a double play ball. The Yankees were down 2-1 in that series against LA and they were losing that game. The Yankees ended up winning that game in extra innings. That play spearheaded the comeback. So instead of being down 3 -1. It was 2-2. A huge difference. The Yankees probably don't win that series without that play.

desertrat Re:

Last years call in the Angels-White Sox series also comes to mind. Strike 3, inning over, but the ump says the catcher didn't catch the ball. Instead of extra innings, Joe Crede comes up and hits a ball off the wall to bring in the winning run, who happened to be the guy that struck out. Angels had won game 1 of the series, this was game 2. Who knows what would have happened if Angels had pulled it out in extra innings? Momentum and home field for games 3 and 4 could have left the White Sox on the outside lookking in.

Does anyone feel Lebron will leave Cleveland?

Do you guys think he will leave Cleveland? He says it's not about the money and wants to make sure that he is put in a situation where he can win championships. If that's the case it wont be New York unless they manage to pick up a big like Stoudamire or Bosh. What do you think? For more information, see boss underwear .



SportsAC Re:

I don't really think he ends up leaving. He is an Ohio guy, born and raised. And although Cleveland hasn't yet succeeded, ownership has shown they are willing to spend to build talent around him.

Plus, where does he go? Knicks? No talent and cap issues won't allow signing 2 max players. Lakers? Most ridiculous rumor I have ever heard. Clippers? Who in their right mind makes that decision?

shamedog18 Re:

It's hard to say. I don't even think he knows where he's going to play next year. I think he gets a kick out of all the little innuendos he gives both the fans who think he will stay and those who say he will go. For more information on this topic see sexy costumes to make .

Malaki Re:

Why would he leave? They might not have everything he is looking for (championship caliber team) but as another poster stated, the ownership is willing to try to put the extra pieces there so they can win.

I am not a huge Cleveland fan, as they seem to be destroying my Pistons this year. But I cannot see Lebron moving to anyplace, and if he does he should just come to Detroit that way it is close to Home

Which NBA team is the most popular?

Which NBA team is the most popular?

I was just wondering if which team in the NBA is the most popular around the world?

Nic531 Re:

No, I don't think Lakers is the most famous NBA team in the world, I will select Houston Rockets, it is just because of Yao Ming brought a huge market Potential for Rockets and definitely Rockets is the most popular team in worldwide!Agree ?

sportdominion Re:

I would say Boston Celtics... just due to the fact that there are many teams in the world called "Celtics" or "Celtic" especially in europe and Ireland...
Boston Celtics is the white guy team LOL... dont want to offend anyone...
but thats why i think they are most popular.

LeBron < Kobe

Lets hear some of your thoughts.

Frostx Re:

Kobe's good but he's past his prime, Lebron will be much better than Kobe in due time.

SportsAC Re:

Toss up really....though over the next few years that will probably change. Lebron just doesn't quite have a supporting cast at this point in his career.

ScoobyEuph13 Re:

This a great argument of who is better. Here is my opinion. They are both good and are true players. The one obvious thing is Kobe has 'Rings' and LeBron doesn't.

I think Kobe is better than LeBron, especially when Kobe first entered the NBA. LeBron is a terrific player, but it is a sly off of Kobe's athleticism.

Arrowhead-Red Re:

From the little I see, I'd take Lebron. When all is said and done, this guy will probably go down as one of the best to have played the game. He hasn't won a ring yet, but he lots of time. And I think he is a better player than Kobe, and he isn't a distraction, which is a big pro for him.

BristolBaller Re:

Well said...not only do they not play the same postion(though they are similar in height,only difference of a couple inches), but they have different types of games...Kobe is more the scorer and finisher...while LeBron is more a facilitator, then he will score if need be...he's starting to develop the art of finishing that Kobe has got down pat...though at the moment i have to say LeBron is better overall as a player...better passer and rebounder...mainly because how many championships you've won shouldn't be in this discussion because thats more about the team around them...if the discussion included championships it'd be Kobe hands down.

2012 MLB Season with John Ryan

Welcome to the MLB edition of the continuing tjhreads with John Ryan. As has been the case with my other threads, I hope that we all can develop and learn more about the game of baseball and all of the infinte handicapping techniiques for this sport. I can't think of another sport that has so many different statistical results and subsequent and dependent rankings.

Love the movie Money Ball and they should have won at least one Oscar for their efforts. It may be interesting to learn what Bill James had told all of us a long time ago and how it was followed and extended by Billy Beane. I think it is still used to this day, but not made public.For more information, see adidas underwear .

Bottom line is,and I have seen this, experienced this, there is absolutely NO WAY any scout can profject that a player under the age of 20 possesses all five of the scouting traits. That was the case with Billy and you can see throughout the movie how he thought back adn wondered what if I had gone to Stanford.

I do beleive baseball at all levels of play requires more team chemistry and managing and blending of personalities than in any other sport. It is far more subjective sport regarding how scouts look at ball players... There are 60-year dash times and pop-times, but there is also the unknown factor of how a young man handles failure. In no other sport are the best players failing 70% of the time, but in MLB the best hitters in the world do exactly that.

John Ryan Re:

I am beginning to post Team Preview on the site. I have competed Miami, Philadelphia, and the Braves. Check-em out adn let me know your thoughts.

Let's discuss futures betting.
Who will win the Divisions and who will be the two wild cards? Give a few reasons why. For more information on this topic see christmas panties .

Reds season has taken a big hit with Madson tearing a elbow ligament.

bmoorewiz Re:

Money line and more than 65 percent will be dogs. As you will you see one of favorite plays is tying up two +140 or higher dogs into a parlay. We will have three team round robins with three dogs. Totals will account for around 15 percent.

Starting Goalie Sources.

Might as well post any link that lists starting goalies in one thread, and then people can view/compare them for themselves. Here's the two I know of.

Second SBR Fantasy Football ESPN League August 24th

There will be two six-team divisions and the regular season will last 13 weeks. There will be six playoff teams, but only the Final 4 will get season points. The two division winners will get a first round bye with the second and third teams in each division facing each other, so the division winners are assured of being in Final 4. The playoff rounds will last one week each in Weeks 14-16. NFL Week 17 will be ignored. The Champion gets 1500 points, the Championship loser gets 500 points and the two semifinal losers each get their 250 points back. Additionally, beginning with Week 9, the high scorers for each week will get 100 points (with ties split evenly). Note that PickWinnersAllDay already has a spot reserved as he and I agreed that I hold on to the 200 points he sent for the first draft, which he was forced to back out off. The first 10 guys to send 250 via the "Give Points" button below will receive a PM with the draft info, as will PWAD when he sends the 50-point balance. Here are the rules, with the major changes from the first draft being the addition of a FLEX position and the addition of one point per reception.

ttwarrior1 Re:

LT, i don't have the pts right now, but alot of freeplay pts, can you hold me a spot. I'll have it paid by then.

Mr KLC Re:

I gotta try to do better this time, since i was one of the ones crying for the Flex Postion to be added, and its a PPR.

CarolinaDaze Re:

Warrior i like beating you in these contests, you're always good competion. I'll loan you the points to play here but i want my points back, not by end of season but by say start of week # 3? Agreed or you want to wait and see what happens?

How the US presidency is more RIGGED than the NBA

It is obvious,every four years the predetermined losing party will nominate a scapegoat to make an total ass of himself in public eye, making it easy for you the brain dead public to choose the winning candidate not realizing you've been fukked up the ass no matter which way you slice it......

With out further ado I give you the winner of the 2012 election,Barack Obama,for you brain dead fukks that need spoon fed.

a4u2fear Re:

If the NBA was rigged, would the finals have ended 4-1 in favor of Miami?

GUMMO77 Re:

Exactly. If it was rigged then this series would have gone down to the wire. Miami was just the dominate team, and only getting stronger.

Emily_Haines Re:

When you go to the rally's and see Ron Paul has 10x the following of any other candidate and he wins every straw poll and says things that make the most sense yet the other guy with all the corporation bribes donations wins you know it's totally rigged.

ChalkyDog Re:

You're partly correct. The thing you are missing, is that the term rigged is a serious misnomer. NBA games are rarely so heavy handed as to be rigged. Instead they are more massaged into helping one side. It is much much easier to do when the teams are so evenly matched.

That said, after game 2, Miami was insanely more dominant. To the point where finessing the outcome couldn't happen. Also, to that point, we must assume that the league wanted Miami to win. So, allowing them to take game 2, then game 3 - is reasonable, no &quot;rigging&quot; need be made. However, game 4 and 5 were so out of hand, the refs were never able to make a few crucial calls to swing the balance, and as a result - the series ended well before the ideal time.

Are the NY Knicks letting Jeremy Lin go?

The Houston Rockets are offering to Jeremy Lin a contract for three years for just ! Damn!!! A lot of money!!! But the Knicks CAN'T let Jeremy Lin leave! They should match the offer!

sportsfanatic Re:

I seriously can't think of a worst situation for lin than going back to play for the knicks after all that has happened. his friend fields is gone. d'antoni is gone. i definitely think he could be benched because new york is now stuffed to the gills with point guards. i just don't think lin would do well in a woodson team.

TwoWays Re:

His not coming back to the Knicks has nothing to do with money but a personal grudge by ownership.

jsmithj88 Re:

how do u figure that? what grudge would he have against management?
lin isnt coming back because management decided not to match.

Summer League basketball

Why on earth have Irving participate? Yes, he didn't "participate" but the thought of bringing him over here was dumb. I can imagine some guy trying his but off for a job going at Kyrie given that he is a big name. Too big of an injury risk.

Waiters needs to take the ball to the rack. Someone must have told him he was a jump shooter. Bad Idea.

As for a positive Zeller looked really good. Summer league is far for perimeter oriented, so he really didn't get many looks, but for what he got he did well with.

Lastly, what the heck is Charlotte doing? Most teams are going straight man to get looks on new guys and evaluate talent. Charlotte is going full court man to man, 2-2-1 full court traps, matchup zones etc. They are making it harder on themselves and other teams to evaluate talent as that is not how the NBA game is.

Pronkville Re:

Waiters with a big shot to put them up and then had a brain fart and called a timeout when he didn't have one, however he didn't really have much of a choice anyway....

I agree, Charlotte was playing some hardcore serious defense, like going 100 mph on defense, hahahah.

mcm.1019 Re:

Charlotte appears to be pretty serious about the summer league...pretty much sent their entire roster to play. I've enjoyed watching some of these games and getting a look at the young guys. Liked what I saw from Zeller yesterday. Waiters didn't shoot it real well, but he was pretty aggressive at attacking. The refs called about 4 or 5 offensive fouls in that game that had me shaking my head...guess it's summer for them too.

nba free agency talk

Lakers trying to trade for Howard. I called him landing there like two years ago, not that it took a genius to see that coming. The Lakers and the Rockets lover their centers.

MoFlo Re:

raptors offer nash a 3 year $36 million deal, he's most likely going to wait and see what happens with D-will and brooklyn.

ray allen getting interest from boston, miami, memphis, and dallas
problem for the heat is they can only offer mini mid-level, only 3 mill a year.

theAteam Re:

It's becoming ever more clear that Kidd is going to sign wherever Williams signs.

It's also being reported that Dwight has demanded a trade to Brooklyn.

I have no idea what their finances look like (and I assume Lopez would have to be moved), nor do I know how this affects the Joe Johnson trade rumor....but one thing is for certain....things are looking up in Brooklyn--one way or the other.

Ron Mexico Re:

I will laugh my ace off if Brooklyn is conent to sign D-Will and keep Gerald Wallace, pair those two with Lopez and Joe Johnson, and say, "we're cool."

Why would a Center not want to get traded to the Lakers? I just don't understand that.

N.B.A. Rookie of the Year

Who do you guys think should be the Rookie of the Year in the N.B.A.?

I'll pick Jamaal Tinsley of the Indiana Pacers. The other night he had a triple-double against the Washington Wizards including a whopping 23 assists.

26 teams passed on him and I thought he might be kind of a bust because he couldn't hit an outside shot in college but he's really turned into a nice player. I know the Warriors were ready to take him with their 2nd round pick but had to settle on Gilbert Arenas. Tinsley reminds me a little bit of Mark Jackson. He isn't a very good shooter but he can post up. He can create for others. And he uses his body to get physical with other players. women costumes .
Nate Re:

I agree with Wedge. With only about 1/8 of the season completed, it is much too early to pick a ROTY.

Spike Re:

Well I've changed my mind since my last post in this thread. It's got to be Pau Gasol for Rookie of the Year this year.

Jamaal Tinsley's kind of been slumping the last few months.costumes sexy .

Flipside Re:

This is what everyone seems to be singing in regards to Pau Gasol these days:

"We don't like P-Gausol, OH NOOO! We love him, YEEEAAH!" lololololololololol. adidas underwear .

Mind my singing voice, I am not a trained singer I am a trained break-dancer though, that is why my nick is called Flipside, its one move I do when I breakdance.

N.B.A. 6th Man of the Year Award

Who do you guys think should get the 6th Man of the Year Award?

I'm picking Bobby Jackson of the Sacramento Kings. He's a great sparkplug off the bench. He's a great defending point guard which is rare for a point guard. And you can also run him at some two. He's a great contrast to Mike Bibby who's more of an offensive point guard. And for a little guy, he does another rare thing. He likes to get inside and mix it up with the big guys to get the rebound.

He's not a great decision maker on the fast break but that's his only weakness.

Flipside Re:

For me its Tyronne Lue, but I'm bias & PLUS I am only being silly! hehe - he hasn't done enough for them team... not compared to what Aaron Mackie last year.

Spike Re:

And you are right, YaBoy.

Corliss Williamson won the 6th Man of the Year Award today.

And Bobby Jackson finished 2nd.

How about the surprising results ?

I think the sleeping little giant has finally woken up & I hope he keeps it going! Garnett & Wally really turned it up on the Lakers, but the Wizards didn't have enough fire power for the more determined to win Bucks! O well, better luck next time M.J. - maybe Hamilton will be able to help you on the next battle!

Spike Re:

Yeah and what's particular impressive about that is look at how the Lakers were playing before the game last night.

They had won 6 in a row themselves and were killing the opposition on the road.

And then they went into The Target Center and just got worked.

Flipside Re:

Yeah I saw that on the news. It must have been a great game. I wish I had gotten to see it on T.V. That was some fight.

I read that Kobe tried to take over the game when Shaq got ejected but Kobe kind of choked, hehe. Kobe missed a game-winner at the end of regulation, a free throw that would tied the game with 8 seconds left in overtime and a jumper that would have tied it with .5 seconds left in overtime.

And how about Shaq going after Brad Miller? I know if a big, big guy like Shaq was going after me and swinging at me, I'd be scared as heck. I'd run too like Miller. He'd probably give you brain damage or something if he connected with your head.
